ราคา Bitcoin ลดลงสู่ $60,000 พลิกลบกำไรที่เกิดขึ้นหลังการเลือกตั้ง Trump

Bitcoin Price Dips To $60,000, Erasing Trump Election Gains

1d ago//Rizwan Ansari
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

วันที่ 6 กุมภาพันธ์ ตลาด crypto ผันผวนหนักเมื่อ Bitcoin ดิ่งลงเกือบ 15% ไปที่ระดับ $60,030 ซึ่งเป็นการลบล้างผลกำไรทั้งหมดที่เกิดขึ้นนับตั้งแต่เดือนพฤศจิกายน 2024 การร่วงลงครั้งนี้ทำให้มูลค่าตลาดระเห็จไปกว่า $350 พันล้านดอลลาร์ โดยได้รับแรงกดดันจากการขายของผู้ขุด Bitcoin ที่ต้องขายทำกำไรขาดทุนเพื่อรองรับต้นทุนการผลิตที่พุ่งสูงขึ้น รวมถึงการถอนเงินจำนวนมากจาก Bitcoin ETFs และการ liquidate ตำแหน่งเดิมพันที่ใช้เลเวอเรจมูลค่ากว่า $2.65 พันล้านดอลลาร์ ปัจจุบันผู้ขุดกำลังเผชิ��ภัยคุกคามเนื่องจากต้นทุนการขุดเกิน $87,000 ทำให้ต้องขาย Bitcoin สำรองออกไป ในขณะที่ความต้องการจากสถาบันอ่อนแอลงตามการไหลออกจาก ETFs ที่พุ่งเกิน $1 พันล้านดอลลาร์ในสัปดาห์นี้ ผลสืบเนื่องทำให้ผู้ถือหุ้นรายใหญ่อย่างบริษัทของ Michael Saylor รายงาน unrealized loss หรือขาดทุนยังไม่เกิดจริงเกือบ $9 พันล้านดอลลาร์ นักวิเคราะห์เตือนว่าหาก Bitcoin ไม่สามารถยืนหยุดเหนือระดับการสนับสนุนที่สำคัญอย่าง $60,000 ได้ ราคาอาจมีความเสี่ยงต่อการปรับตัวลงลงอีกต่อเนื่อง

EN

On February 6, the crypto market experienced a sharp crash as Bitcoin plunged nearly 15% to $60,030, erasing all gains made since the November 2024 election. The drop, which wiped out approximately $350 billion in total market value, was driven by massive selling pressure from miners forced to sell at a loss due to rising operational costs, heavy outflows from Bitcoin ETFs, and widespread liquidations of leveraged positions worth over $2.65 billion. Miners are currently struggling as production costs exceed $87,000, pushing them to deplete reserves, while institutional demand has weakened with weekly ETF outflows surpassing $1 billion. Consequently, major holders like Michael Saylor’s Strategy reported nearly $9 billion in unrealized losses. Analysts warn that if Bitcoin fails to hold the critical $60,000 support level, further downside risk remains imminent.

Key Points

  • Bitcoin price dropped nearly 15% to $60,000, erasing post-election gains and $350 billion in market value.
  • Miners are selling holdings due to high production costs over $87,000, while Bitcoin ETFs saw over $1 billion in weekly outflows.
  • Over $2.65 billion in leveraged positions were liquidated in 24 hours, with Michael Saylor's Strategy facing $9 billion in unrealized losses.

Article

On February 6, the crypto market saw a sharp crash as Bitcoin plunged nearly 15%, wiping out around $350 billion in total market value in a single day. Bitcoin’s price fell to $60,030, erasing gains made since its October peak near $126,000. This drop also wiped out the entire “Trump bump” rally from November 2024, as selling pressure increased from miners, profit-taking, deleveraging, and global market fears. Bitcoin Price Drop Linked to Miner Selling Pressure One of the biggest pressures is coming from Bitcoin miners. Data shows that the average cost to mine one Bitcoin has now risen above $87,000. With Bitcoin currently trading near $65,000, many miners are operating at a loss. To cover expenses, they are being forced to sell their holdings. Bitcoin miner Reserves have fallen consistently over the past months and now stand near 1.806 million BTC. This indicates that miners are selling more coins than they are keeping, adding to market supply. Bitcoin ETFs Record Heavy Outflows At the same time, institutional demand has weakened sharply. Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) saw heavy outflows again. On February 5, spot Bitcoin ETFs recorded $258.8 million in net withdrawals. Although this was lower than the $544.9 million outflow seen a day earlier, the total outflows for the week have already crossed $1.07 billion. Liquidations Add More Pressure on BTC Price Liquidations also played a major role in pushing prices lower. In just 24 hours, more than $2.65 billion worth of leveraged crypto positions were wiped out. Around 82% of these liquidations came from long traders who were betting on higher prices. The single largest liquidation happened on Binance, where a BTCUSDT position worth $12 million was forcibly closed. Michael Saylor’s Strategy In Big Losses Even major corporate Bitcoin holders felt the pain. Michael Saylor’s Strategy reported an unrealized loss of about $9 billion, equal to 16% of its massive Bitcoin holdings. Despite this, Saylor urged investors to stay calm and “HODL.” Yet some leaders, including Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse, reminded traders of Warren Buffett’s famous advice: be fearful when others are greedy and greedy when others are fearful. Bitcoin Price Outlook Bitcoin is now testing one of its most important support levels in years. If the price fails to hold above $60,000, analysts warn that more downside could follow. Even traders on the prediction market Kalshi expect Bitcoin to touch $58,000 in 2026. Never Miss a Beat in the Crypto World! Stay ahead with breaking news, expert analysis, and real-time updates on the latest trends in Bitcoin, altcoins, DeFi, NFTs, and more. FAQs Why is the Bitcoin price down today? Bitcoin crashed nearly 15% due to miners selling at a loss, over $1 billion in ETF outflows, and $2.65 billion in leveraged positions being liquidated in a single day. What could help Bitcoin recover after this sharp crash? A recovery typically needs reduced selling pressure, stabilizing miner activity, slowing ETF outflows, and renewed spot buying at key support levels. Will institutional investors return after ETF outflows? Institutions often re-enter gradually once volatility settles and price levels appear attractive relative to long-term fundamentals. What signs should investors watch for a Bitcoin recovery? Key signs include declining liquidations, stable miner reserves, ETF inflows, and higher trading volume near support levels.
